subject: Collect Bad/Broken VPDs in BMC
commitMessage:
Collect Bad/Broken VPDs in BMC

When there is a vpd failure case due to the
corruption in vpd data, this commit collects the bad vpd
into BMC tmp/bad-vpd directory, so that this bad-vpd directory
gets into BMC Dump collection.

Tested on simics.
1.Corrupted the data of a vpd file.

 dd if=/dev/zero of=/sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/ahb:apb:bus@1e78a000/1e78a500.i2c-bus/i2c-9/9-0050/9-00500/nvmem bs=1 seek=170 count=3

2.No bad-vpd directory before executing the commit changes.

root@rainier:/tmp# ls
dbus_properties.json                                                               systemd-private-9dfe8fba43254dfc8b7be9e4278a3ced-systemd-resolved.service-8pLWbo
ibm-read-vpd                                                                       systemd-private-9dfe8fba43254dfc8b7be9e4278a3ced-systemd-timesyncd.service-7yowK9
images                                                                             vpd-manager
overlays                                                                           vpd-tool
systemd-private-9dfe8fba43254dfc8b7be9e4278a3ced-dbus-broker.service-hb47BQ
root@rainier:/tmp#

3. Due to the data corruption, ibm-read-vpd throws exception

root@rainier:/tmp# ./ibm-read-vpd --file /sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/ahb:apb:bus@1e78a000/1e78a500.i2c-bus/i2c-9/9-0050/9-00500/nvmem
std::exception
root@rainier:/tmp#

4. And collects the broken vpd into bad-vpd directory in /tmp

root@rainier:/tmp# ls
bad-vpd                                                                            systemd-private-9dfe8fba43254dfc8b7be9e4278a3ced-dbus-broker.service-hb47BQ
dbus_properties.json                                                               systemd-private-9dfe8fba43254dfc8b7be9e4278a3ced-systemd-resolved.service-8pLWbo
ibm-read-vpd                                                                       systemd-private-9dfe8fba43254dfc8b7be9e4278a3ced-systemd-timesyncd.service-7yowK9
images                                                                             vpd-manager
overlays                                                                           vpd-tool
root@rainier:/tmp#

5. The bad vpd file is stored in /tmp/bad-vpd directory.

root@rainier:/tmp/bad-vpd# ls -l
-rw-r--r--    1 root     root         16384 Mar 28 19:54 i2c-9-0050
-rw-r--r--    1 root     root         65504 Mar 28 20:01 spi22

(vpd-names of i2c eeproms will be in the pattern "i2c-busNumber-eepromAddress";
for spi eeproms - "spiBusNumber")

Signed-off-by: PriyangaRamasamy <priyanga24@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I34fb8c61c79e02ca72d7e99413baebf7e5cb3d53

Change has been successfully merged by Santosh Puranik

I would really want to avoid this unconditional copy. I guess you had to do this because we move the vector to the Parser. In that case, you can move the code that writes that bad vector to a file to wherever the buffer is owned.
I don't like this ... why can't we just change the signature of this to take the VPD buffer by reference and get rid of the move?

even if we get rid of the move in the getParser() signature, the logic in the getParser api moves the vector again to the respective parser constructors.
So We face the same issue again..

So its better to have a local copy of the vector only once at the place before calling the getParser() api..

The patchset 7 has a working code with the local vector copy created only once (at the place before calling the getParser() api..)

rebased on top of https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openpower-vpd-parser/+/42005. 
Issue resolved
Can we define this in const.hpp with some meaningful name?

Altering this logic to find vpd name from generic path only. (Current logic uses udev path)

As once we merge this commit <https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openpower-vpd-parser/+/36295>, the ibm-parser code translates udev path to generic path and this getBadVpdName() logic won't work.
This TODO is now out of place
Why did you have to rearrange this?
Why would the name ever be empty? The message below is misleading too, it seems to indicate the file is 0 bytes in length, but really this is checking for the name of the file not its contents.
Please change this to a const ref too
Please get rid of the TABS for consistency.
We do not need at both the places. Line 1017 and 1052?
Please check stream for failure condition.
I did not mean remove the TODO :) The TODO is still very much valid. I was merely saying it was out of place because of the extra line you added. Now, you can put the TODO back.
This should use BAD_VPD_DIR config option.
Have you verified that this work with the new generic paths?
yes. verified. this works only for generic paths .

How does this behave if there is a file already in that path? What happens with the write() then?

If the size of the old file is more than the size of vpdVector, can the file be partially overwritten?

It might be best to delete the old file (if any) and then recreate it.
Nit: API Or just omit it - A function is an API.
Please use fs::remove() So that you don't need that .data() call. Also please check the return value and handle it (we can throw an exception)

will use fs::remove.

why to throw exception if the bad vpd file doesn't exist in /tmp/bad-vpd
Don't we land up here if the file does exist? So we should check for whether removed failed
